extends java.lang.Object

      GameEngine(int ticksPerSecond)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine(int ticksPerSecond)
        Creates a GameEngine that progresses Levels forward with the given amount of ticks per second.
        Parameters:
        ticksPerSecond - How many times the Level is supposed to tick per second while this GameEngine is active.

      • run

        public void run()
        The engine will periodically progress the current Level forward until stopped. Or the Level is finished by loss or victory.
        Throws:
        IllgegalStateException - if no current Level has been set for the GameEngine.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pause the periodic progressing of the current Level.

      • setCurrentLevel

        public void setCurrentLevel(Level l)
        Set the Level the Engine should progress forward while running. Multiple GameEngines may affect the same level .
        Parameters:
        l - The Level to be progressed by the GameEngine.

      • getCurrentLevel

        public Level getCurrentLevel()
        The Level the engine currently is progressing.
        Returns:
        The Level the engine currently is progressing.
